title: What are some nonstandard units of measurement? - Quora

response.answer_text: Non standard units of measurement: For time: pendulum swing, pulse rate For weights: grains of corn, liters of water For distances :span, arm length, 50 sheets of paper For Volume: glass of water, spoonfuls, teaspoonful drops For area : one page of paper the letter size, one sheet of plywood For speed: as fast as the cheetah, as fast as the turtle

Well let’s see a pufteenth — anywhere between a bit and a bigger bit. As in “this piece needs to be a pufteenth longer.” Also used in multiples, as in “I was out by 3 pufteenths” a Bee’s dick — usually a bit less than a pufteenth. As in “I measured the space three times and only missed getting it right by a bee’s dick.” cigarette paper — I think this might be an actual measurement. As in “you couldn’t get a cigarette paper between them.” a country mile — anywhere between about a [statute] mile and 2–1/2 [statute] miles. Also used as “missed by a country mile”, meaning I didn’t hear or see the shot so it must have missed by a country mile. feel free to use the comments to add more definitions.
